titles.title: Military Voting Rights bill
Armed Services Voting Improvement Act

To prohibit a State from determining that a ballot submitted by an absent uniformed services voter was improperly or fraudulently cast unless the State finds clear and convincing evidence of fraud, to direct the Secretary of Defense to conduct a study of methods to improve the procedures used to enable absent uniformed services voters to register to vote and vote in elections for Federal office, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on House Administration.

bill.summary: 2/7/2001--Introduced. Armed Services Voting Improvement Act - Prohibits a State from refusing to count a ballot submitted in a Federal election by an absent uniformed services voter on the grounds that the ballot was improperly or fraudulently cast, unless the State finds clear and convincing evidence of fraud in the preparation or casting of the ballot by the voter.Directs the Secretary of Defense to study and report to Congress on methods to improve the procedures used to enable absent uniformed services voters to register to vote and to vote in Federal elections.
